pros: Family atmosphere while surrounded by very intelligent staff.
cons: There are only certain sites available.

review_title: DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE ACCEPTING A JOB
pros: Modern, above average facilities for school size and peer institutions, Moderate to Low cost of living offsets below average pay. Open positions and quick turnover leads to opportunities to advance quickly in many departments. First job, stepping stone for starter careers.
cons: Despite many good faculty and staff, there is no clear leadership and a handful of VPs and floaters run everything with little loyalty or concern for underlings. Virtually no job security, extremely high turnover in areas like residence life, athletics, students services, and custodial and dining services leads to unstable and difficult student experiences, which affect faculty and staff support. Department Admin has little structure or experience, and staff/faculty often get misleading or outright wrong directions. "Fear Culture" truly exists here. Lack of institutional control derives from inexperienced low level leadership and upper level disconnects. Keep your head down and stay under the radar for best results here.

review_title: Good opportunities but lack of management
pros: Good stepping stone in your career, lots of research opportunity
cons: Sexist language by coworkers without consequences, lack of management, poor to no communication about responsibilities, underpaid

pros: Located in a pretty area
cons: Especially at the CVM they make up roles to give friends and family undeserved raises.

pros: Friendly management and respectful treatment, manageable work load
cons: No reserved parking spots for faculty

review_title: it's all about the medical side
pros: great brilliant colleagues, nice benefits, some very helpful staff
cons: humanities told they're irrelevant. all the time

job_title: Standardized Veterinary Client in Harrogate, TN
pros: It is rewarding and a close knit group
cons: Scheduling is not very consistent

review_title: Great Place for a Graduate Assistant
pros: Fantastic working culture and environment. Management is helpful and very supportive of needs.
cons: Sometimes lack of traffic led to the graduate assistants having little work to do. This could be changed by giving them projects to generate more engagement.

pros: good school, great professors, quiet location
cons: location is in a secluded area

pros: lovely location in a rural area
cons: not a lot to do in the area

pros: Nice students. Some good staff.
cons: Upper administration doesn't make their own decisions, mostly based off of one guy with a lot money and 1920s values.

pros: Professional, kind workers that are very helpful and care about the student doctors.
cons: You have to have a flexible schedule and not depend on the income.

pros: there are no massive benefits
cons: there are no massive cons

job_title: Head Soccer Coach in Cumberland Gap, TN
pros: Great degree programs and facilities.
cons: Toxic work environment. Lack of institution leadership. Poor communication and clearly defined roles and responsibilities. Power and money hungry leadership results in large employee turnover each year.

pros: Great people who listen to you
cons: They do a pretty good job of addressing issues, just not very timely.

job_title: Assistant Professor of Biology in Harrogate, TN
pros: Still waiting to decide but so far good
cons: Don't always listen to faculty

pros: Rural location with minimal traffic
cons: Rural location with no restaurants

job_title: Director of Student Accounts in Harrogate, TN
pros: Great medical benefits and free education
cons: Lower than average salary compared to other employers

pros: A good relationship between faculty and students.
cons: The pay scale was a little lower than other COMs

pros: good hours, no weekends, holidays or on call. Good benefits. Nice office space. It was great to have summers off with my kids.
cons: Overworked most of the time. Management did not care about your needs but always was able to make allowances for themselves.

pros: Good people and easy to balance work life
cons: You have to really work to change things for the better. A lot of resistance to change.

pros: Aggressive strategy of becoming a center of excellence for professional schools (Veterinary Medicine, Law, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Advanced Practice Nursing, Dentistry, Occupational Medicine).
cons: Harrogate Campus is very rural; 45 minutes to big box stores.

review_title: Has potential, not living up to it.
job_title: Director of Residence Life in Harrogate, TN
pros: Beautiful area, family culture (if you are the in group). If you enjoy rural living this would be a good area.
cons: Negative culture in some areas, a lot of politics, envokes "at will" to end employment more than most campuses I have worked with.

job_title: Assistant Professor of Literature and Languages, Chair in Harrogate, TN
pros: Good locations, good people, support for research.
cons: No tenure and one year contracts.

pros: Good professional opportunity with limited previous experience
cons: Excessive control by board of trustees

pros: The health benefits were good.
cons: Toxic work environment that ruined my health. I was overworked, underpaid,  yelled at, and gaslit. I personally experienced racism and homophobia as well.

pros: Wonderful People To Work With
cons: I never got to stay long enough due to needing better Wages

pros: LMU-SMS thoroughly prepared me to enter the workforce as a competent Physician Assistant.
cons: I do not have any complaints about the program because they did an excellent job.

review_title: All signs of ethical collapse. It should be truthfully named DeBusk University.
pros: After a job at LMU anywhere you work will look better because it is.
cons: Signs of ethical collapse: pressure to increase enrollment without increasing faculty (medical school), fear and silence (can be fired without a reason, anger DeBusk and you are gone), "young 'guns" and larger than life CEO (young faculty and a CEO--DeBusk--who told faculty they were a dime a dozen!}, weak board of trustees (they let the executive committee have free reign), conflicts, goodness in some areas (medical school) used to coverup stupid decision to start a law school good only if you stay in TN). What college or university does not have a music major? Answer: LMU because too few majors for management. What college prefers to keep a criminal justice program (poorest major for success in law school) and gets rid of the second best (philosophy and religious studies.) See book THE SEVEN SIGNS OF ETHICAL COLLAPSE by Marianne Jennings for full description of what will happen.

review_title: A good first teaching position, but don't overstay your welcome
pros: Relatively easy to get a first faculty position and gain valuable teaching experience. Beautiful location in the mountains. Very low population and clean air. Cost of living is extremely low.
cons: Poor job security. Administration is very hostile toward faculty. Turnover rate is unbelievably high (lost 120 of ~500 faculty last year alone). Pay is extremely low, even compared to similar institutions. It is difficult for many people to live comfortably in such an isolated geographical location.

review_title: LMU shows how paranoid it is
job_title: Associate Professor in La Follette, TN
pros: Beautiful campus. Many fine people work there.
cons: I was offered a chance to teach one class as an adjunct. After getting the faculty handbook I was given a separate form to sign that was not there when I taught there for 13 years. The new form informed me that the faculty handbook was advisory only and could be changed without informing the faculty and DEPARTED FROM BY THE ADMINISTRATION AT ANY TIME. Since the handbook includes how sexual harassment issues are settled and other personnel problems it means that the administration can fire someone for the offense but not another person (administration??) for same offense. I refuse to accept the identity of someone not worthy to be treated fairly.

review_title: LIncoln Memorial University - A great place
pros: The people and the place make LMU a terrific place to work. Driving into town, cresting the hill, sets the picturesque campus against the beautiful mountains. LMU is a friendly place to work where people truly care about each other. I am so grateful to have a position here.
cons: LMU is in a remote, rural, setting. If you need the trappings of the city, and all that goes with it, the LMU may not be the place for you. If however, you don't mind shopping at Wal-Mart and making special trips to Knoxville for the larger malls and big box stores, then LMU is the place to be.

pros: Hard to think of one
cons: Employees will undercut each other simply for personal gain, instead of looking at the big picture, they all suck up to DeBusk in hopes of gaining his attention. Unfortunately if you catch him on a bad day he will fire you on the spot. The place is a cancer that will eventually spread into your personal life. You can give your all and get overlooked time and time again for others just because of a name. A political cesspool is the best way to describe this place. If you have a shred of dignity do not work here, and don't be fooled by the glamorous facade that is put on.

pros: It's a beautiful location. The faculty and staff are very friendly. Everyone is seen as being part of a family. There are many opportunities for professional development. New employees are frequently asked how they are doing to make sure that they are adapting to the new job well.
cons: It's in a rural location. There isn't much to do in the community.

pros: Flexible hours in summer. Great students for the most part. Beautiful campus. The medical school is a great and the nursing program is strong.
cons:
Terrible leadership in multiple departments. High turnover rate of faculty.
Upper leadership thought they could say anything to those below them and made it known they didn't care if you resigned. Terrible employee attitudes because of hostile management style.

review_title: Good place to get those first few years of Experience
pros: LMU was a good place to get a start in my respective field.  The small staff, enabled many employees to cross train in various fields.  No expenses spared when it comes to technology.  Good benefits to employees with children or spouses pursuing degrees.
cons: Pay doesn't match what people could be making elsewhere, which leads to a high turnover rate.

pros: Great benefits friendly staff and students.
cons: CITO is very unhappy in is work and makes it a hostile work place for other IT employees. There were 6 that left because of him from the time I was hired to the day I left.

review_title: I enjoyed my time in IT and still have friends from there now.
job_title: Programmer Analyst I in Knoxville, TN
pros: IT group is close knit, good challenges to tackle, never a boring moment, plenty of opportunities for growth.
cons: The only thing I could say is that the pay is on the lesser than mid-grade side for any position you want.

review_title: Great place to grow in your career
job_title: Professor of Microbiology in Harrogate, TN
pros: Opportunities to grow as you help educate students. Beautiful location. Quiet setting. Involved with undergrad and grad students. Much more than a sleepy little liberal arts college.
cons: Rural setting about 55 miles from Knoxville. About 45 minutes from Morristown. Local shopping in Middlesboro KY. Emerging local eateries scene and farm to table businesses.

pros: great people at my location, reasonable pay, excellent benefits available, including free tuition
cons: main campus seems extremely unorganized, keeps satellite locations from getting things done. Also, salaries based on COL in a tiny rural town, but the powers that be won't make accommodations for higher living costs in a bigger city

review_title: Low salaries, low morale, low institutional ethics
pros: The location is lovely and the campus well maintained
cons: Low salaries, low morale because chairman of board thinks university is his plantation and he can do to his slaves what he wants; no job security, board of trustees out of touch with what is going on, financial status of university hidden,, do not take a job at LMU; you don't deserve the stress

pros: Fellow faculty are mostly hardworking, friendly folks.
cons: Administration have no clue what it is like to be a researcher or a teacher. Faculty are treated as easily replaceable. Turnover is very high, with many departments lacking a single full professor. No tenure system, only annual contracts.

pros: Depending on where you are on campus, you are paid well for the area it is in. Some room for advancement.
cons: Some parts of campus are paid better than other parts.

review_title: Good and steady but many changes in supervision
pros: Great co workers and meet lots of other admissions counselors in other areas
cons: Far travel across state and supervisors changed a lot

pros: Some instructors and staff are special people.
cons: Pay scale and promotions are lacking.. Claims to be "family", but that is far from true.

pros: Opportunities to wear many hats and responsibilities with a very supportive team of coaches and administrators.
cons: Location and growth opportunities could be better

review_title: Terrible Management; A toxic work environment
pros: Fellow professors are friendly, so are most employees.
cons: Management is terrible. From Deans to Department Heads, they don't listen to professors' concerns or needs. The president of the university considers professors "a dime a dozen" (his words, used at a faculty senate meeting)

job_title: Assistant Professor, Communication in Harrogate, TN
pros: Small university beautiful campus, small city
cons: Very laxed about everything. Students not committed

pros: Caring and very helpful staff
cons: Location is a little rural

job_title: Director of Clinical Education in Harrogate, TN
pros:
Autonomy
Some faculty were very supportive.
cons:
Never had enough help to get major projects done.
Cut-throat.
No team environment.

pros: Housing and Meal Plan included. Great people to work with.
cons: Employee morale, low wages, very little support, nepotism abounds and lack of privacy or notice before entering staff apartments.

pros: Acceptable location; good classroom technology
cons: No faculty support from administration, poor pay for faculty, remote/rural location.

review_title: They don't care about their staff
pros: a beautiful campus and surroundings
cons: staff are simply numbers, not valued

pros: Only positive is the benefits
cons: Administration, retaliation, no job security, favoritism
